subject: ENGLISH
title: Chapter 18 Growing up
content:
--- Page 1 ---
becceeeeeeseeeeeeees 18. Growing up

Mr Thomas Frog

Little Tommy Tadpole
began to weep and wail,
For little Tommy Tadpole
had lost his little tail;

And his mother didn’t know him
as he wept upon a log.

For he wasn’t Tommy Tadpole,

but Mr Thomas Frog.
— CJ Dennis

3K 3K 3K

The Butterfly

The fuzzy little caterpillar
Curled upon a leaf,

Made herself a chrysalis
And then fell asleep.

While she was sleeping,
She dreamed that she could fly,
And later when she woke up

She was a butterfly!

POPPERS EEE EHH LEER E EEE EEO EE EEE EEE E EEE EEE OEE EEE ESEEEEEEEEEEE EE EEEEE HEE EEEE HEE EEEH ESE EEE ELELEE HEEL EEE EE EEE LEED

e fuzzy : covered with soft, fine hair that sticks up. e chrysalis : a stage in the
life cycle of a butterfly. It is also the name of the hard case in which the caterpillar
lies till it is transformed into a butterfly. e tadpole : a stage in the life of a frog or
toad. At first, a tadpole has a long tail but not arms or legs.

Things TO Os Peceeccccccccccccccccccccccccrccccccecceceereseesee reese senses sess esessesseseesessesseseeseeees

1. Find more information about the life cycle of a frog and a butterfly.
Present the information with the help of pictures, photos or diagrams.

2. From the poem ‘Mr Thomas Frog’, mention —
(a) one fact (b) one imaginary thing.
